alert.note: Alert for Dixie; Taylor (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 22 at 9:59PM EDT until further notice by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Tallahassee FL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Florida... Steinhatchee River near Steinhatchee (US 19) affecting Dixie and Taylor Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Steinhatchee River near Steinhatchee (US 19). * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 19.5 feet, Water begins to flood downstream at Steinhatchee Falls Park. Minor flooding of roads begins along River Road NE. Water will begin to encroach onto the yards of residences in the Ancient Oaks Community in Steinhatchee. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 19.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 PM EDT Thursday was 19.6 feet. - Forecast...Minor flooding is occurring. The river is rising and minor flooding is forecast with moderate flooding possible. - Flood stage is 19.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.6 feet on 07/27/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
